results.title: All around us: radiation
results.creator_credit: Derek Cunningham and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description: Explains radiation, how it was discovered and how it is measured. Considers its applications and possible effects on health. Shows how radiation is used to our benefit in industry, medicine and research.
results.description: Explains radiation, how it was discovered and how it is measured. Considers its applications and possible effects on health. Shows how radiation is used to our benefit in industry, medicine and research.

results.title: Who's running this school?
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, John Honey, Tasmania. Education Dept. and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Investigates some of the problems of school administration and management by focusing upon a dramatized presentation of one of the first days in the job of Annie Probert, a newly appointed school principal. Although she is not feeling well, her day looks fairly simple. However, as the days develops, unexpected problems intervene and Annie becomes a victim of the multiple expectations that are a universal hazard of the job. Useful in the areas of decision making, conflict resolution, time management and leadership.

results.title: Sister Forsythe's casebook
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Outlines the work done by a school community nurse in early detection of potentially serious health problems in students. Shows diagnosis of petit mal, child abuse, depresion resulting from overweight, bed wetting, poor coordination. Notes how the school nurse works in conjunction with parents and techers.

results.title: Seymour's view
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An extra terrestial being, Seymour, gives us his views on how language development seems to occur in our society and how it could develop with a little more positive involvement on the part of parents.

results.title: Ergon-office
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Designed to promote an awareness of ergonomic hazards in the office. Emphasis is placed on the hazards induced by new technology such as VDU terminals and printers.

results.title: Fitness leader weight training encyclopaedia
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Health, Physical Education and Recreation
results.brief_description: Presents a range of weight training exercises for different parts of the body. Indicates exercises that develop muscular strength and endurance, muscular size and definition and aerobic fitness.

results.title: Fitness leader stretching encyclopaedia
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Health, Physical Education and Recreation
results.brief_description: Presents a set of stretching exercises designed for different parts of the body. Emphasizes the importance of isometric contraction and motion stretching for flexibility of muscles and connective tissue.

results.title: Fitness leader exercise encyclopaedia
results.creator_credit: Bill Edmonds and Australian Council for Health, Physical Education and Recreation
results.brief_description: Designed for trainers, coaches, physical educators and other fitness leaders. Shows over one hundred exercises and sequences and explanations of correct and incorrect techniques. All exercises and sequences are numbered for quick and easy references and grouped for major muscle groups.

results.title: Study is not a dirty word
results.brief_description: Shows how to develop effective study techniques. Covers efficient notetaking; improved memory of new information through better listening, reading and notes; the necessity to relate all information to a central idea; and the motivation to do it. No other credits available.

results.title: Say it with words
results.brief_description: There are important differences between writing in private and speaking in public. This program demonstrates the following skills: preparing the speech, rehearsal, and the correct use of visual aids. A humorous program with Judy McBride, David Argue, Tracy Harvey and Mark Little.
